items.title: Parity 1.7
items.markdown:
With the Parity 1.7 release we are proud to announce experimental support for light clients and web wallets. The light synchronization mode can be enabled by starting Parity with `--light`. The web wallet is a public Parity node that keeps the keys and signs transactions using your local browser storage. Try it at [wallet.parity.io](https://wallet.parity.io) or run your own with the `--public-node` command-line flag. Other important features are the experimental WASM contract support, the PubSub API and separate signer apps for iOS and Android.

To get an overview of everything included, read the [release accouncement](https://blog.parity.io/) on our blog.

items.title: Questions?
items.markdown:
Have questions? We would like to get them answered. The [Parity wiki](https://github.com/paritytech/parity/wiki) should be the first stop for any general questions in running the software, configuring it or just trying out some of the basic or advanced features of Parity, either as a user, developer or miner.

If you prefer direct interaction with the team, join us on our [gitter channel](https://gitter.im/paritytech/parity) and feel free to ask any questions.
